headline: Knight-Swift Transportation Holdings Inc. Endorses Union Pacific – Norfolk Southern Merger
summary: PHOENIX, September 02, 2025--Knight-Swift Transportation Holdings (NYSE: KNX), the nation’s largest full-truckload carrier, today announced its support for the proposed merger between Union Pacific Railroad and Norfolk Southern Corporation. The company believes this historic rail merger – uniting the Western and Eastern rail networks into the first truly coast-to-coast railroad – will greatly benefit intermodal transportation by enabling seamless single-line service from coast to coast. headline: White Paper: State of the Industry – September 2025
summary: The September 2025 “State of the Industry Report” — presented in affiliation with Ryder — shares an in-depth overview across the trucking, maritime and intermodal markets, as well as what to expect in the coming weeks. The data contained within the report provides breakdowns of capacity, volumes and rates. In this report, you will find: […] The post White Paper: State of the Industry – September 2025 appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: How To Play The Union Pacific-Norfolk Southern Arbitrage
summary: The Union Pacific-Norfolk Southern merger offers a technical arbitrage opportunity, with a 14% spread and a 36% implied probability of deal closure. Learn more on UNP stock here.

headline: Is Union Pacific Stock Underperforming the Nasdaq?
summary: While Union Pacific has lagged behind the broader Nasdaq Composite over the past year, Wall Street analysts remain moderately optimistic about the stock’s prospects.

raw.headline: Is Union Pacific Stock Underperforming the Nasdaq?

headline: Goldman Sachs’s Minnis Sees M&A Ramp-Up, AI Spending Boom
summary: “We’ve been talking for years about the return of M&A, but what we’ve seen in terms of corporate boardrooms and sponsor willingness to transact is really picking up,” Christina Minnis said in an interview on Bloomberg TV.  M&A activity has built up over the summer following a disappointing start to the year, when volatility surrounding US trade tariffs sapped enthusiasm for dealmaking.
